verse: अजातपक्षा इव मातरं खगाः स्तन्यं यथा वत्सतराः क्षुधार्ताः । प्रियं प्रियेव व्युषितं विषण्णा मनोऽरविंदाक्ष दिदृक्षते त्वाम् ॥

terms.ajāta-pakṣāḥ: who have not yet grown wings

vedabase.meaning: O lotus-eyed Lord, as baby birds that have not yet developed their wings always look for their mother to return and feed them, as small calves tied with ropes await anxiously the time of milking, when they will be allowed to drink the milk of their mothers, or as a morose wife whose husband is away from home always longs for him to return and satisfy her in all respects, I always yearn for the opportunity to render direct service unto You.

gpt.meaning: Like winged goats seeking milk from their mother just as dependent calves, afflicted by hunger, seek dear milk; distressed as if dear, the mind, with lotus-like eyes, seeks You.
